verses.plain: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.

tokens.t: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou
not spoiled; and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! when thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled;
when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.

verses.plain: O LORD, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

tokens.t: O
, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: be thou their arm every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

verses.plain: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.

tokens.t: At the noise of the tumult the people fled; at the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.

verses.plain: And your spoil shall be gathered like the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.

tokens.t: And your spoil shall be gathered
the gathering of the caterpiller: as the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.

verses.plain: The LORD is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.

tokens.t: The
is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath filled Zion with judgment and righteousness.

verses.plain: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times, and strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is his treasure.

tokens.t: And wisdom and knowledge shall be the stability of thy times,
strength of salvation: the fear of the
his treasure.

verses.plain: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.

tokens.t: Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.

verses.plain: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

tokens.t: The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: he hath broken the covenant, he hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.

verses.plain: The earth mourneth and languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed and hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their fruits.

tokens.t: The earth mourneth
languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed
hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; and Bashan and Carmel shake off

verses.plain: Now will I rise, saith the LORD; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.

tokens.t: Now will I rise, saith the
; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.

verses.plain: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath, as fire, shall devour you.

tokens.t: Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your breath,
fire, shall devour you.

verses.plain: And the people shall be as the burnings of lime: as thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.

tokens.t: And the people shall be
the burnings of lime:
thorns cut up shall they be burned in the fire.

verses.plain: ¶ Hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are near, acknowledge my might.

tokens.t: ¶ Hear, ye
far off, what I have done; and, ye
near, acknowledge my might.

verses.plain: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

tokens.t: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell with the devouring fire? who among us shall dwell with everlasting burnings?

verses.plain: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

tokens.t: He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of oppressions, that shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, that stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, and shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;

verses.plain: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence shall be the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters shall be sure.

tokens.t: He shall dwell on high: his place of defence
the munitions of rocks: bread shall be given him; his waters
sure.

verses.plain: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.

tokens.t: Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: they shall behold the land that is very far off.

verses.plain: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where is the scribe? where is the receiver? where is he that counted the towers?

tokens.t: Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where
the scribe? where
the receiver? where
he that counted the towers?

verses.plain: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue, that thou canst not understand.

tokens.t: Thou shalt not see a fierce people, a people of a deeper speech than thou canst perceive; of a stammering tongue,
not understand.

verses.plain: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle that shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

tokens.t: Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacle
shall not be taken down; not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.

verses.plain: But there the glorious LORD will be unto us a place of broad rivers and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

tokens.t: But there the glorious
unto us a place of broad rivers
streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.

verses.plain: For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us.

tokens.t: For the
our judge, the
our lawgiver, the
our king; he will save us.

verses.plain: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

tokens.t: Thy tacklings are loosed; they could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

verses.plain: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.

tokens.t: And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: the people that dwell therein
forgiven
iniquity.

footnotes.text: high: Heb. heights, or, high places
of…: Heb. broad of spaces, or, hands
Thy…: or, They have forsaken thy tacklings
